name: Vitalize Care
headline: Streamlining Clinical Operations for Health Systems
description:
Vitalize Care is solving the most pressing clinical operations problems for health systems, starting with optimizing staffing and scheduling. We help hospitals dramatically reduce labor spend, improve operational efficiency, and unburden clinical leaders from hours of work per day.

We're partnered with some of the country's most innovative health systems, and are excited to share more details soon!

founders.name: Veeraj Shah, Founder
founders.description: I'm an MD/PhD student turned founder of Vitalize, where we work with healthcare employers to improve the mental health + productivity of their staff. Prior to Vitalize, I co-founded two behavioral health nonprofits and co-led digital health strategy initiatives for the US Surgeon General and IBM. Originally got interested in healthcare through informatics research, where my most recent work was funded by the Gates Foundation. Love chatting about all things hiking and coffee!

founders.name: Sanketh Andhavarapu, Founder
founders.description: Co-Founder and Chief Product Officer of Vitalize Care, where we work with healthcare employers to improve the mental health of their staff. Prior to Vitalize, I co-founded a revenue-generating education nonprofit, and also conducted clinical, basic science, and health services research, co-authoring over 20 peer-reviewed publications. Previously led business development for seed-stage pediatric healthtech startup, and was also a fellow with .406 Ventures.

generated_description:
Vitalize Care is a San Francisco-based startup launched in 2022 that's tackling the inefficiencies of clinical operations in health systems. It's part of Y Combinator's W23 batch, which speaks to its innovative approach and potential. The company's mission? Simplifying clinical operations to help hospitals optimize staffing and scheduling. 

At its core, Vitalize Care focuses on three key problems: reducing labor expenses, improving operational efficiency, and relieving clinical leaders of the tedious manual work that eats up their time. They're developing a software platform that uses predictive scheduling to identify staffing gaps well ahead of time, ensuring that health systems can deploy the right nurses to meet patient needs without excessive labor costs.

The platform offers an integrated solution for staffing and scheduling, which means no more overstaffing or scrambling to fill shifts at the last moment. Through AI, Vitalize Care automates much of the scheduling process, saving nurse leaders significant time each day (by over 30%, in some cases). This not only streamlines operations but also aims to improve nurse retention with more flexible and transparent scheduling options. 

With a small but dedicated team of just 13 employees, Vitalize Care is already partnering with some of the most innovative health systems across the country. Tom Blomfield serves as their Group Partner, lending further credibility to their mission.

The benefits of their solution are felt across the hospital hierarchy—from Chief Nursing Officers who can visualize staffing in real-time to COOs who want to make staffing operations efficient without hiring additional full-time employees. CFOs see reduced labor spend, while nurse managers save hours of scheduling headaches.

To sum up, Vitalize Care is positioned to transform how health systems manage staffing, allowing them to respond proactively to the ever-changing landscape of patient care. If you want to learn more, you can check out their offerings at [Vitalize Care’s website](https://vitalize.care).
